page.title: 17The Fox Inn - Boars Hill
page.content: The Fox is the only public house in the area under review and is a good example of a typical English country pub. One of the features of our age is the changing character of local pubs. Darts are still played as are dominoes and crib but pool tables are now a common feature so are electronic games and duke boxes which provide LOUD music, not enjoyed by all| Food, particularly basket snack meals are widespread and many, including the Fox, provide more formal meals of a very high standard. Typical prices in 1985:- Pint of bitter beer ...... 78p Tot of spirits ............ 68p Glass of wine ............. 60p Fruit juices ...............30p Ploughman's lunch 1.50: Sandwiches 70p Scampi & chips 2 pounds:Sausage & chips 1.50
